metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6353 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
net/sctp/socket.c in the Linux kernel through 4.10.1 does not properlyrestrict association peel-off operations during certain wait states, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (invalid unlock and doublefree) via a multithreaded application.  NOTE: this vulnerability existsbecause of an incorrect fix for CVE-2017-5986.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1054.61
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1057-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1057.61
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1016.25
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-49.52~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-49.52~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-49.52~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-gke - 4.4.0-1012.12
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1012-gke - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-75.96').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.61').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1057.61').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1016.25').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-49.52~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
